metadata.title: CVE-2021-23961 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Further techniques that built on the slipstream research combined with amalicious webpage could have exposed both an internal network's hosts aswell as services running on the user's local machine. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 85.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23961` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
